name: Prescott Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: We booked the Prescott through our agent as a four star hotel. I would agree with that rating only for the location of this hotel- Union Square could not be closer. But the room we were given could have used some refurbishing- wallpaper peeling away, carpet seems old and musty, paint could have been done by a 10 year old. The awkward angles in the bathroom left me with bruises on my elbows while trying to dry my hair. We were on the third floor, and the street noises were relatively loud (as well as a rocking party in the private club across the street on Saturday night) but as I always travel with ear plugs this was not an issue- if you are a light sleeper this would be irritating. Our last night we ordered some late room service, and the one thing that I specified- I could have no sesame seeds on my hamburger bun, (which the lady checked with the kitchen when she took my order and assured me there were none on the buns tonite) and when my meal arrived- I was scraping sesame seeds off- too tired and hungry to send it back! The service from the front desk and especially Lane as Concierge brought the hotel back up to standards for us. The inclusion of the breakfast buffet ensured that we kick started our days with fresh fruit, bagels and coffee. Free WiFi when you join Klimpton on line. We love San Francisco, but I would explore other hotel options for our next visit. It is not worthy of four stars. Note: See Wicked if you have the chance! It was a highlight for us!!
reviews.title: In the centre of it all, but needs spiffin up!
cute hotel
reviews.text: area- nice in the day time. at night, the feel is totally different. doesn't feel safe anymore. we took a cab from the airport. on the way back, we took the BART- was very convenient and close to the hotel (but there were some delays on the BART so leave early).

hotel- feels worn, but cozy. we stayed on the 6th fl, club room level and had to change to a diff elevator bank. some of the floors are like a maze, but we got the hang of it. the room was not very spacious, but worked for it. the windows open pretty wide. that was nice for us since we liked the breeze, but may not be so good for everyone, esp young kids. the room was clean. the beds, confortable. breakfast came w/ the room, which was nice even though there was nothing hot. our floor was very quiet, we could not hear any one else on the floor.
reviews.title: The Location Was Great But ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ...the room was teeny, tiny (2 queen beds stuffed into a 250 sq. ft. room). Seriously, walking from the bed by the window required a squeeze by the other bed, it's that small. Perhaps a better choice would have been two double beds, or paying extra for another level.
reviews.title: Enjoy the wine reception each evening

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The furnishings, wallpaper etc also looked kind of tired.
reviews.title: classic comfort

reviews.text: The Prescott Hotel is in a Great Location, Just a few blocks from Union Square.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very clean, and the housekeeping service was very good indeed. The view out of the room was not one to write home about, and I agree with another guest on keeping the curtains closed at all times.
reviews.title: Perfect location, Pleasant staff, Comfortable room

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay here very much, my only gripe being that I was charged for two nights Valet parking, when I only used the facility the one night. Upon checking out it took me what seemed like an age to get my Bill corrected. Apart from that it's a hotel I would recommend to anyone staying in the area.
reviews.title: Charming Characteristic With Convenience

reviews.text: We found the Prescott by a chance internet search and when we noticed it was among the top 50 boutique hotels, we decided to give it a try. We were able to get a AAA rate (265) and although it was more than what we wanted to pay, we liked the location, the description, and, well, we were leaving in 5 days! All worth it. Plenty of space in our room, bathrobes and slippers, a very comfortable bed and spacious armoir. The deluxe continental breakfast and daily paper were great to have as part of our room rate. The fitness room was small but sufficient. The location was, in fact, very convenient and we walked all over the city and made it back for the evening wine tasting in the lobby. Others have remarked about the staff and we agree that they are top notch. Each concierge was knowledgeable, helpful, and pleasant - some pretty funny, too. And, Patricia at the front desk added those small, almost unnoticeable touches, that really helped. We wrote the manager afterward to commend everyone. One night we were too tired to dine out and the staff recommended a little Thai restaurant for take-out nearby - we ate in the lobby by the fire with a bottle of wine we picked up in Sonoma. What could be better! Stay here. We'll be looking for Kimpton hotels whenever we travel.
reviews.title: Incredible Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Prescott Hotel in San Francisco definitely is a small hotel situated near Union Square. The building is about 7 floors high which doesn't have a great view at all. You will have to keep your curtain drawn for privacy. Otherwise, the people in the building next door can look through their windows to see your every move.
reviews.title: Prescott's a charming hotel
So much to see in San Francisco
reviews.text: We just returned from a 4 day weekend in San Francisco and I don't know where to begin. The Prescott Hotel was decent. The staff is definitely helpful but the room is small. Coffee and tea are served from 6 am until 9:30 am and wine is served from 5-6 in the hotel lobby. The location is great - a block to all the great shopping that Union Square offers. Great sushi restaurants, cafes, bars and restaurants can be found in the blocks surrounding the hotel. We took a tour of Sonoma and Muir Woods with Extranomical Tours on Friday. You will only spend an hour in Muir Woods but according to my sister - If you have seen one redwood you have seen them all. The tour stops at three wineries and a cafe for lunch. In order to pack in all the wineries you only stay for about 45 minutes at each winery. You have enough time for tastings, photos and a quick walk around the grounds. The wineries do not provide a tour of the grounds nor do you see anything about how the wine is made. It' great if you are only there for a few days like we were and are trying to fit everything in. We hit all the tourist spots - the Cannery, Ghiradelli Square, the Wharf, a streetcar, a cablecar, the Haight and Alamo Square. I recommend the $11 one day all you can ride pass or the $18 three day pass for public transportation. Two cablecar and one bus ride and the pass will pay for itself.

Myself and some friends stayed at the hotel recently October 09. When we arrived after a long flight we were greated with smiles from the reception staff and were very helpful in explaining everything. The room was clean and tidy. The resteraunt staff were helpful, chaty and the food was excellent. The location of the hotel is near to the shops and other areas of interest. Only one fault outside my window there were fans blowing all night and day it sounded like you were constantly in an plane.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
Thoroughly enjoyable 5 night stay in Downtown SF.
reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights in early September. Great location, only 5 mins walk to Union Sq. & 10 mins gentle downhill to Market/Powell station. We took the BART train from the airport (recommend this) & had a 15min walk up Powell & along Post to hotel. No problem. Relax when you see the Donnatello Hotel! Staff were very helpful & attentive, particularly front desk & internet engineer. He arrived at our room after only 8 mins & sorted our internet access problem staight away. More than adequate Continental breakfast spread with lots of fresh fruit. Sets you up for the day. It's worthwhile going Club class for the Happy 'Hour'. Great way to unwind after a day sightseeing. Meant to be 4.30-6pm but fortunately tended to overrun as we usually arrived about 5.30 after a full day in the city. Hints to leave were very subtle. Met some really nice folk from all over the world, picked up a few tips about other places we were going to visit. Our room was a bit small but very comfortable. Spent 3 nights in another cheaper hotel nearby later on & appreciated the difference. We would DEFINITELY go back to the Prescott..

reviews.title: Great Location & Staff, A Little Worn on the Edges
reviews.text: I had a comfortable 3 night stay. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The location is one block from Union Square and a main trolley line. Easy walking distance to China Town, Convention Center, etc. The room was comfortable and clean, but small. Overall the place is a bit worn and needs a refresh. Worn out carpet, stained bath curtain, tiny pillows, 19" TV, no in-room coffee - all things that could be updated. I had dinner a couple of times and found the found to be good (not great, but good). My other issue is noise - I was on the second floor overlooking Post, and the street noise was horrible. I should have changed rooms, but...never got around to it. Overall, I'd stay here again if the price was right.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a good value hotel with great staff, good rooms and a brilliant location.
reviews.title: Highly satisfactory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend & I stayed at the Prescott for 5 nights in September. Throughout, the most amazing thing was the service: We had a minor problem with the cold water, and called down to the desk. It was fixed in literally 15 minutes. The concierge printed our return boarding passes for us in 2 min. with no charge (the Nikko 4 yrs ago wanted $12). Throughout, the staff was very pleasant and attentive to our needs. And more....The room was not huge but big enough. It was nicely appointed and cozy and clearly recently redecorated. The bathroom was lovely. All in all, an excellent hotel. Only two cautions: since this is a small & only 7-story hotel, there is no "view"--just the buildings across the street. I did miss that. Also, for the elderly or infirm--there is absolutely NOTHING to hold onto when in the shower, and the tub floor was a bit slippery. But other than that--A+++++!!!
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel w great service!

reviews.text: The hotel is at a good location, it looks very old, but very clean, the rooms are very small but clean, the toilets are very clean and well maintained. The Internet service was free since i registered for the Kimpton membership.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text: There is no lobby for the hotel but the service of the people is exceptional. The response is prompt, professional and polite. The staff is very helpful and courteous.
reviews.title: Very satisfied with club level at the Prescott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is good , but the options of complimentary breakfast is few.
reviews.title: Great location, very helpful staff, and a good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel needs to modernize, and revamp the rooms, and maintain the service standards
reviews.title: Great value for money, execellent location

reviews.text: With Priceline my best friend and I got a great deal for our mini spring break destination! We chose the Prescott because we love Kimpton hotels. I noticed that Kimpton has many hotels in SF, all in great locations. The Prescott is just one short black from Union Square, which is full of restuarants, cafes, and shopping! The cable cars are right there as well.
reviews.title: Gotta love Kimpton!

likes.liked: — The beds are too die for!
likes.disliked: — our tv set was pretty old, compared to the rest of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are roomy, EXTREMELY comfy beds! Soft down sheets, and pillows. Great concierge! She printed out different menus from the local restaurants, we went to Filos which is right across the street! Fantastic italian!
reviews.title: Overated for me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the evening they serve great wines, and drinks. Plus delicious chocolate chip cookies at the front desk! Kimpton hotels are wonderful for there price, and creative, friendly enviroments.
reviews.title: Loved the Prescott!

reviews.text: End of March, I was staying at the Marriott on 4th St. which I would recommend, and stay at again. Clean, updated, modern design and good location. I switched to the Prescott at the recommendations of friends. It was once very nice but needs to be touched up and really cleaned. It reminds me of European hotels that have an old world feel, which is nice if the hotel is top notch. Also, the heating and air conditioning system is strange, once it reached the room temperature you program, it switches to air conditioning to maintain it. So we could never get the room to be comfortable. Most of the staff was excepionally nice. Samll exercise room but adequate. The location is fine, about 3 blocks from Union Square, next to the Postrio restaurant, which gives guests preference seating/reservations. With my experience at the Marriott, which was about 40 dollars more per night, I doubt I would stay here again. (P.S. I travel a fair amount for business & pleasure).
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and Staff

reviews.text: We stayed here to do the "Bay to Breakers." Perfect location, very comfortable and a friendly staff. We actually drove to Freemont and took Bart into the city. Got off at Nordstrom's and took an easy walk to the hotel...no parking hassels! Can't wait for the next time.
reviews.title: Prescott is great

reviews.text: The Prescott is in desperate need of an update. Don't be fooled by the lobby. It is dark and dusty, needs new carpets and a paint job, even on the "club level" floors. The club level is actually located in a separate building so be ready to be confused by having to take the elevator to 4 in the main building and then cross over through the club lounge to a separate set of elevators if you are on a floor above 4.We felt like a confused rat in a maze....especially since we were not given any guidance at check in especially since the
reviews.title: Hotel does not live up to Kimpton experience: Needs major updating

reviews.text: main elevator does take you to higher floors but only the main bldg. This was disconcerting when the only double room for our teens was in the regular building and the elevators were sporadic but stairs were accessible..although we didn't need more climbing after the hills!! The "club level" happy hour is from 4:30-6:30, but it was crowed immediate from 4:30 and we rarely got a seat. The best part of the experience was the bartender who was very friendly and spirited and managed to do the work of 4! Thankfully everyone recognized that too and he rakes in big tips...and deserves every dollar! He was a one man show! The staff was also friendly. The hotel is in a good location during the day but VERY loud with dumpsters crashing at night. Didn't think this lived up to the Kimpton experience but the price and location for the teens was hard to beat.
reviews.title: Not Great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Customer service was good, but the rooms are pretty small, the bed is not as high as any other hotel bed I've seen. Also, outside of the bathroom, I was only able to to find one set of electrical outlets and it was not easy to reach. There was also no shower cap (pretty standard at hotels). The floor creaked a little (I was on the second floor).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couldn't have asked for a better hotel! The location is fantastic, so close to union square, shopping and public transport. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The hotel is elegant and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Would highly recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights and was sad to leave!
reviews.title: Excellent location, great if you have a Club Room

reviews.text: Loved this hotel! We were on the Club Level and our room was smallish but gorgeous. Neutral colous scheme, big comfy bed, nice quality bedlinen and large bathroom.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: In the afternoon they had a cocktail hour, with free drinks and nibbles. Divine!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel experience
Excellent hotel. Kimpton has another winner!
reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights at the Prescott on business in early December 2006. When I arrived to check-in, I was upgraded to a 2-room suite on the executive level of the hotel. (The clerk simply said it was my "lucky day".) The room was large, immaculate, and came with nice club level amenities like free continental breakfast and evening reception, shoe shine, high-quality toiletries, etc. The staff was uniformly pleasant from the housekeepers to the general manager. Union Square is 1.5 blocks away and it's a 5 minute walk to the MBTA Powell St station. I travel a fair bit, and there's no question that my stay at the Prescott was a great hotel experience all around.

reviews.title: A mixed bag
reviews.text: We are staying here from Dec 28 to Jan 1, 2007. It's a great little hotel. The rooms is excellent, with nice linens, towels and comfy bed. Usual amenities of a 4 star hotel, iron & board, minibar, safe and morning paper. Unusual was the free overnite shoe shine, 4 different newspapers and coffee in the fireside lobby lounge from 6:30 AM. The location is good too, only 2 blocks from Union Square. The staff is friendly, helpful and attentive. I highly recommend this Kimpton Hotel Group property. We have stayed at their Monaco and Vintage Plaza Hotels here in SF, and this one is the best yet.

The Prescott was a very nice hotel. Pretty, excellent staff, very clean. We spent four nights there the week before Christmas. We only had one major problem and that was with the HVAC. We set the thermostat for heat with a temperature of 70 and automatic fan (only when the heat came on). However, when the temperature in the room dropped below 70, the fan came on and blew cold air for, what seemed an eternity (in actuality probably at least 5 minutes), before it blew hot air. Staff told us it was an old building and HVAC system and that was the way it was - they did adjust the vent louvers away from the bed.
reviews.title: It is always great
Good for yoga
reviews.text: I stayed here for three nights whilst passing through San Francisco to business elsewhere in the US. I was attracted to the hotel by it's location and it having yoga kits and a yoga channel. The location was also good for a solo woman.

I had a Queen Deluxe room on floor 6 overlooking Post Street. The room was easily large enough to accommodate yoga practice with only minimal moving of furniture. The yoga kit provided consisted of a mat, belt and block, all in a new condition. Unfortunately the yoga channel (32) was showing cookery programmes. The considerable mirroring in the room helped me to improve my postures though.
reviews.title: Like very much
A cozy, unique spot - close to everything you need
reviews.text: The room itself was nice; neutral decor, comfortable bed, quality linens. Movies were $9.99. Bath products were L'Occitane rather than the advertised Aveda but I prefer them so it made little difference.

reviews.title: Unbelievable value
reviews.text: Although I did not use the concierge service I did see Amanda going the distance in trying to obtain tickets for shows. The staff were pleasant and seemed good at responding to the different needs of guests.
I endorse the comment about the MUNI pass, $18 for three days unlimited travel on buses, cablecars and trolley buses.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel in Union Square Area!

likes.liked: — Elegance of total hotel and the quiet room.

description: The elegant Prescott Hotel, in the vibrant heart of San Francisco's Union Square, was recently named one of Travel + Leisure's top 50 hotels in North America. Stepping through its doors makes it immediately apparent why, with its quiet, exquisite sophistication and attentive service. Discerning travelers are drawn to this lovely boutique hotel and the adjacent Postrio restaurant just steps from Union Square, Moscone Center, Chinatown and more.
